user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketShutdown:
```c
int32 OS_SocketShutdown(osal_id_t sock_id, OS_SocketShutdownMode_t Mode)
{
    OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;
    OS_object_token_t            token;
    int32                        return_code;

    /* Confirm that "Mode" is one of the 3 acceptable values */
    BUGCHECK(Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ || Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE ||
                 Mode == OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READWRITE,
             OS_ERR_INVALID_ARGUMENT);

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sock_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        stream = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, token);

        if (stream->socket_domain == OS_SocketDomain_INVALID)
        {
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_TYPE;
        }
        else if (stream->socket_type == OS_SocketType_STREAM && (stream->stream_state & OS_STREAM_STATE_CONNECTED) == 0)
        {
            /* Stream socket must not be connected */
            return_code = OS_ERR_INCORRECT_OBJ_STATE;
        }
        else
        {
            return_code = OS_SocketShutdown_Impl(&token, Mode);

            if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
            {
                if (Mode & OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_READ)
                {
                    stream->stream_state &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_READABLE;
                }
                if (Mode & OS_SocketShutdownMode_SHUT_WRITE)
                {
                    stream->stream_state &= ~OS_STREAM_STATE_WRITABLE;
                }
            }
        }

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No pointer variables or pointer-to-object usages in this function are suitable for const-qualification under MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. The only pointer declared is:
- "OS_stream_internal_record_t *stream;" — this pointer is used to modify the object (stream->stream_state is cleared in two places), so it must point to a mutable object and cannot be const-qualified.
Other apparent pointer usages are addresses of local objects passed to APIs:
- "&token" passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_SocketShutdown_Impl, and OS_ObjectIdRelease — these APIs likely require a modifiable token (output/operation parameter), so the address cannot be to a const-qualified object.
- "OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_stream_table, token)" returns a pointer to the internal stream table entry which is subsequently modified; therefore it cannot be const.
No other pointer declarations or pointer-typed function parameters appear in this snippet that could reasonably be changed to point to const-qualified types without altering program behavior. Consequently there are no suspicious fragments to investigate for Rule 8.13 in this function.
